sentences.sContent: We followed the tyre tracks across a muddy field.
sentences.sCn: 我们顺着车辙穿过一块泥泞的田地。

sentences.sContent: The tracks, which looked like a fox’s, led into the woods.
sentences.sCn: 这些足迹看着像是狐狸留下的，一直通向树林里。

sentences.sContent: ...And people who elect to track their sleep may try to get more sleep than the average person...
...In Amsterdam officials are using Airbnb listings to track down unlicensed hotels...
...Australian scientist David Warren developed a flight-memory recorder that would track basic information like altitude and direction...
...a technique that could help track the movements of criminal suspects or unidentified murder victims...
...from football to track and field events...

synos.tran: [铁路]轨道；[古生]足迹，踪迹；小道
追踪；通过；循路而行；用纤拉

phrases.pCn: n. 径赛成绩记录；过去的成绩或成就
正确地；走对路了；未离题的
重回正轨；重上轨道；改过自新
双声道，双声轨（录音磁带）
竞赛的跑道；跑道形电磁分离器
轨道系统；追踪系统；薪金线制度；分轨制

words.tran: 无路的；无足迹的；不在轨道上行驶的
追踪；追查；描摹；摹图；显迹
拉纤者，纤夫；追踪系统，[自] 跟踪装置；追踪者

trans.tranOther: a line of marks left on the ground by a moving person, animal, or vehicle
